channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can Bill Ackman Turn Social-Media Stardom Into a Blockbuster IPO?
item.description: The billionaire investor is aiming to raise billions of dollars for a publicly traded fund next week.

item.title: Hasbro beats second-quarter estimates, goes 'all in' on digital gaming segment
item.description: Though Hasbro's revenue declined 18% overall during the quarter, Wizards of the Coast and the digital gaming segment grew 20%.

item.title: Carmakers' Inventory Pain Is Consumers' Gain
item.description: As Ford struggles with the cost of repairs, Chrysler owner Stellantis and Nissan focus on thinning out dealer lots.

item.title: American issues weak profit forecast after backfired sales plan, industry oversupply
item.description: The carrier's profit fell 46% during the second quarter even though revenues rose.

item.title: Medicaid Was a Boon to Insurers During the Pandemic. Now, Not So Much.
item.description: Insurers with a focus on Medicaid are seeing higher costs per member after millions of enrollees were forced out of the plans.

item.title: Keurig Dr Pepper earnings meet estimates as higher prices fuel U.S. soda sales
item.description: Keurig Dr Pepper's second-quarter earnings and revenue met Wall Street's expectations.

item.title: CrowdStrike Outage Puts its Financial Reporting Under Scrutiny, Too
item.description: The cybersecurity firmâ€™s preferred revenue measure looks especially dubious following its global mishap.

item.title: Southwest profit falls 46% as airline takes 'urgent' steps to increase revenue
item.description: Southwest is under pressure from an activist investor after it lagged competitors.

item.title: An Increase in Uninsured Drivers Is Pushing Up Costs for Everyone Else
item.description: The number of drivers without car insurance has risen since the start of the pandemic, increasing the burden on everyone from other motorists to tow truck drivers.

item.title: Jeep, Dodge maker Stellantis reports 48% drop in first-half net profit on weak U.S. sales
item.description: Auto giant Stellantis on Thursday reported a steep drop in first-half net profit, citing reduced volumes and lower market share in North America.
